issue.title: [ios] An educational hint that explains how to make routes without Point2Point tab

labels.name: UX
labels.description: User eXperience, an issue with usability

issue.body: Caused by: https://github.com/organicmaps/organicmaps/issues/5954 and https://github.com/organicmaps/organicmaps/pull/6220 Point to point tab from the bottom tabbar will be removed soon, so it needs to explain to users how to make routes easily. There are some ways to do that: 1. popover view (it is more suitable than an alert or toast) with a short explanation text that hides when the user taps on the screen (may contain some additional controls, links, buttons, etc) 2. add red-dot badge to the "?" tab and the same educational text inside the "about" screen which hides after reading Is there any other suggestions or comments on how this can be implemented?

comment.body: @biodranik I used the same approach as in the Download button, but I encountered an unexpected behavior when the tint color changed 4-5 times per appearing so... The main trick was that tint for MWMActionButton is overriding on runtime by KVC in storyboard... and this is really not obvious to debug when color can change value from 3-4 places %) Should I create PR with this tinting? --- And one more question: If there are red badge on the "?" tab should I show FAQ screen immediately? Or About -> FAQ (in that case user will see both screens and can go back with 2 taps. Also loading of 2 VCs at one time with a lot of info can impact performance and animations...) Here I move "How to build a route" on the top of FAQ) ![Simulator Screen Recording - iPhone 14 Pro - 2023-10-27 at 15 36 37](https://github.com/organicmaps/organicmaps/assets/79797627/7b4d0760-8907-436e-9034-9b9e0d702ea8)

issue.title: Build fails with "unknown target 'desktop'"

labels.name: Linux Desktop
labels.description: Ubuntu, Gentoo, Red Hat, Debian, Cent OS, Fedora, etc.

issue.body:
It happens after building the `generator_tool` target (which doesn't have qt positioning enabled).

To reproduce (current master)
```
$ tools/unix/build_omim.sh -r desktop
# Builds fine

$ tools/unix/build_omim.sh -r generator_tool
# Builds fine

$ tools/unix/build_omim.sh -r desktop
...
ninja: error: unknown target 'desktop'
```



Looks related either to 
- #6244
- or #6054 

FYI @Ferenc-

issue.title: Map tweaks

labels.name: Enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request, an improvement of some existing feature

issue.body:
Hi Guys

Your app is totally cool. I am doing a 1500km solo canoe trip across South Africa right now, and your app is a staple map for me.

Check out the story on YouTube.
Still have 500km to go. Have completed about 1000km asof today. 

Footprint Zero on YouTube.
https://m.youtube.com/channel/UCwR7NmYONAAq6me4ZbeXkNQ

Below are some suggested tweaks to the UI in a real world situation.

Topo-lines altitudes text drift out of screen area. Need to swipe to find them. Please keep them always visible.

Topo-lines altitudes font size too small.

Topo-lines altitudes density. It is useful for me to see better granulation of topo-lines. Would be useful if the density of the labels can be adjusted. Example, every topoline, every second topo line, every 100m, every 200m, every 500m, etc.

Ability to add custom icons, like a tent icon, house icon, car icon, etc. I would like to add my own icons besides the ones already present.

Ability to change icon size by long clicking a specific icon. This allows importance to be added to a given icon position. Example,  My house icon can be set larger than other icons.

Well done on your work. You have really built a usable real world app.

issue.title: Map tweaks

labels.name: Enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request, an improvement of some existing feature

issue.body:
Hi Guys

Your app is totally cool. I am doing a 1500km solo canoe trip across South Africa right now, and your app is a staple map for me.

Check out the story on YouTube.
Still have 500km to go. Have completed about 1000km asof today. 

Footprint Zero on YouTube.
https://m.youtube.com/channel/UCwR7NmYONAAq6me4ZbeXkNQ

Below are some suggested tweaks to the UI in a real world situation.

Topo-lines altitudes text drift out of screen area. Need to swipe to find them. Please keep them always visible.

Topo-lines altitudes font size too small.

Topo-lines altitudes density. It is useful for me to see better granulation of topo-lines. Would be useful if the density of the labels can be adjusted. Example, every topoline, every second topo line, every 100m, every 200m, every 500m, etc.

Ability to add custom icons, like a tent icon, house icon, car icon, etc. I would like to add my own icons besides the ones already present.

Ability to change icon size by long clicking a specific icon. This allows importance to be added to a given icon position. Example,  My house icon can be set larger than other icons.

Well done on your work. You have really built a usable real world app.

issue.title: Native GeoJSON format support

labels.name: Enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request, an improvement of some existing feature

labels.name: Bookmarks and Tracks
labels.description: Bookmarks, imported tracks, and KML, KMZ, KMB, GPX import or export

issue.body:
It would be great to implement native support of [GeoJSON](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GeoJSON). GeoJSON is less popular than GPX, but implementing GeoJSON format should help people with importing their Google Maps bookmarks from Google Takeout dumps. GeoJSON is also used by [uMap](http://umap.openstreetmap.fr/en/), which is the best online companion for Organic Maps. I have 100+ tracks in GeoJSON recovered from other tools, mostly from uMaps and Google.

See also:

- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GeoJSON
- https://github.com/organicmaps/organicmaps/issues/624

comment.body:
FYI I adapted a little Python script to get as much info out of Google's Takeout JSON as possible. Some stuff is impossible without looking up and geocoding their obfuscated Maps URL, but this works for 90% of the stuff. Might be a good reference if someone goes to implement this and then wonders why a bunch of their starred places are at `0,0` https://stackoverflow.com/a/77371264/1076092

One thing I couldn't get was `<color>` in the resulting file, unsure why that's failing.

issue.title: Weird rendering of roads in navigation

labels.name: Drape
labels.description: Drape OpenGL, Vulkan and Metal graphics rendering engine

milestone.title: Release Blockers
milestone.description: The most important issues that are blocking the next release.

comment.body: https://github.com/organicmaps/organicmaps/pull/6208 PR introduced a bug. And only on iOS.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -209,9 +209,9 @@ if (PLATFORM_LINUX OR PLATFORM_ANDROID)
 endif()
 
 if (NOT SKIP_TESTS)
-  set(SKIP_TESTS FALSE)
   enable_testing()
comment.body:
This is implied by `include(CTest)` https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/command/enable_testing.html
BTW, is there any reason to prefer `SKIP_TESTS` over the official `BUILD_TESTING`?

It uses crowd-sourced OpenStreetMap data and is developed with love by MapsWithMe (MapsMe) founders and our community. No ads, no tracking, no data collection, no crapware. Please donate to support the development!

repo.name: organicmaps
repo.description: 🍃 Organic Maps is a free Android & iOS offline maps app for travelers, tourists, hikers, and cyclists. It uses crowd-sourced OpenStreetMap data and is developed with love by MapsWithMe (MapsMe) founders and our community. No ads, no tracking, no data collection, no crapware. Please donate to support the development!

issue.title: Building name is put in building number field, prevents saving edits
issue.body: https://www.openstreetmap.org/node/10029240717 (51.4821019, -0.0080749) https://www.openstreetmap.org/way/1095646248 (51.48291,-0.00837) these poi are tagged with `addr:housename` and `name`, which seems to push the housename to the housenumber field: this prevents saving edits until the housename is deleted (which it shouldn't be)

comment.body:
If only the Editor is impacted, then only it should be fixed. Any ideas on how to do that?
At the upload stage the original OSM feature is downloaded, and we can check there what was the original tag (addr:housename, addr:housenumber or name).

issue.title: [ios] An educational hint that explains how to make routes without Point2Point tab

labels.name: UX
labels.description: User eXperience, an issue with usability

issue.body: Caused by: https://github.com/organicmaps/organicmaps/issues/5954 and https://github.com/organicmaps/organicmaps/pull/6220 Point to point tab from the bottom tabbar will be removed soon, so it needs to explain to users how to make routes easily. There are some ways to do that: 1. popover view (it is more suitable than an alert or toast) with a short explanation text that hides when the user taps on the screen (may contain some additional controls, links, buttons, etc) 2. add red-dot badge to the "?" tab and the same educational text inside the "about" screen which hides after reading Is there any other suggestions or comments on how this can be implemented?

comment.body: I think we are already tinting the Download button in PP in the same way (tap/long-tap a non-downloaded area to see it). LGTM.

issue.title: Update "Add a Place to the map" UI
issue.body:
For users who are new to adding new locations, it is not quite clear what is happening when adding a map, this needs to be improved.

**Criteria**

- When pressing and holding (Long Press) on a point on the map that doesn't have anything there, that location displays as 'Unknown Place'.  In addition to the current 4 buttons at the bottom, add a button called 'Add Place', to the right of the 'Route to' button, and to the left of the 'Share' button.
- In the 'Add a place to the map' feature (press hamburger button):  Rename 'Location' to 'Add to OpenStreetMap. Rename the "Done" button to "Select".  Update the text at the top to say "Drag the map to set the cross on point of the new location and press 'Select'".
- On the next step of selecting a category, replace the 'ALL CATEGORIES" text with "Select the category of the new location".
- On the next step, rename the 'Save' button to 'Submit'.
- After the Submit button is pressed, display a message at the top saying "Thank you! The place has been submitted to OpenStreetMap and will be available for everyone to see in a future version of Organic Maps".

comment.body:
@community-build please sync issues with Android UI (it's newer).

I would also split it into several smaller issues:
1. Place Page change.
2. Menu change.
3. Editor flow texts change.

Note that Long Tap is extremely rare, most users do not know about it.
Also, note that there's no "Share" button on Android, it's now near the (x) button, like in Apple Maps. That was done to have more space for other useful buttons.

issue.title: iOS: Respect Dark/Light theme settings on CarPlay
issue.body:
There are Auto/Dark/Light settings in OM and a big issue about it here: #749 

At the moment, the CarPlay implementation always follows the car's settings ("auto" mode). It should also respect  "always light" and "always dark" settings.
